name: Metal Ballerina
description:
This 2 1/2'' long conglomerate of components reminds me of a ballerina.

Included in this ballerinas 'outfit', we've got fine silver and copper charms as well as sterling, copper and brass components, the majority made by me. The metals started out as clay, PMC3, CopperClay and BronzeClay.

name: Winged Cicada
description:
This simpler Cicada only has one side with the addition of a pair of wings!

Made from existing altered components, the wings are held together with balled up fine silver, the bug measures 3" long.

name: Fruitful Earrings
description:
This pair of earrings has stainless earwires and has been added to for interest and movement.

They have been colored with alcohol inks, a strong colorant when added to metal.

Pearls, 24 ct. gold plated pollen balls, and some small vintage findings come together to create these lovely and light earrings. I send them with large sterling backs included.

name: Double Winged Cicada
description:
In this two sided Cicada we are presented with a void that you might choose to add to.The cicada has two sets of movable wings. They are fire patinaed offering up a lovely silver hued highlight.

This 3" pendant offers movement and light sound and an opportunity to question what makes you soar?

All held together with a soldered sterling jump ring and fine silver wire.

name: Empty Winged Bean
description:
In this empty Winged Bean you have a void that can accomodate some additions!

What might you add, either through the addition of headpins or jump rings or resin and additional treasure?

Brass pieces, fire patinaed and riveted. Soldered jump ring holds pieces together

name: Black and White Winged Heart Pod
description:
This 3 1/4 long pod features some of my favorite things!

From the outside it looks like a big coffee bean, I added some wings for  levity, a black and white heart  (made by Eleanor Macnish) to remind me that there are at LEAST 50 shades of grey, a green mass of lentil beads, crocheted by Karen Flowers, a drop of blood for warrior remembrance and a small poppy pod that has an inclusion, a soldered pod from a different source. This all comes together and closes so that from the outside you only see the winged bean, a whole world awaits discovery.

Comes with a supple leather cord.

name: Heart Pod
description:
This 1 1/2' pod form has been filled with the addition of a 'warm heart' charm made by me and soldered together to form a void that could be added to with your love charms.

I love the noise, color and sentiment of this fire patinaed piece!

name: Highly Textured Rings and a Shell/Pod dangle.
description:
This 2" diameter set of rings features a triple linkage, these 3 links are intertwined and highlighted by a copper shell , all made from CopperClay.

The green that helps define the wonderful texture has been achieved through a resin addition.

This would make an interesting clasp, pendant or component.

name: 3 Copper Charms!
description:
These 3 charms were all made from Rio's CopperClay~

The flower has been enameled, the other 2, a shell and fossil have been tumble polished and can be polished to  more of a copper color,  if desired.

The fossil has a 14 gauge piece of fine silver fired in place. There is no hole yet in the 'stem' of this piece to increase your designing potential.

name: 3 Charms, 3 Metals.
description:
These 3 charms, all made from different metals includes a fine silver cloud, a bronze eucalyptus pod and a copper cone with a hole straight through. I like to fasten these onto  things with the addition of a balled up silver headpin.

The "Silver Cloud" is a goof with a hole already in it waiting for a jump ring to attach it to it's unknown as yet soul mates.

The Eucalyptus is ready to attach witha fired in bail, the backside of this has a stamped lotus blossom.

name: Long, Lean Electroformed Pod
description:
From tip to toe this pendant measures 4" long. It consists of a 'Crown of Thorn' pod, a glass pearl, some polka dot daggers crocheted together by Karen Flowers, a brass calyx over top of the fine silver dangly pod on the bottom.

One of the best parts about electroforming is that you are left with the volume and not the weight that is encountered in traditional casting, consequently this piece is surprisingly light in weight.

A collage of textures, this piece commands exploration.

name: Charms, 4 different ones~
description:
These charms are made from pairs of brass stampings, some old, some new. I have connected them with sterling soldered jump rings and have created pod additions out of either copper or bronze to add interest and movement to the charms. 

The inside remains open and ready for your additions,possibly coloration, resin and any treasure small enough to fit inside or you can leave them as is, a warm color achieved through heat patination.

Your charm may differ slightly from picture.

name: Enameled Green Pod Pendant
description:
This 1 1/2" long pod has been enameled as has the leaf addition. The interior consists of a glass dagger bead crocheted by Karen Flowers as well as a beautiful carnelian bead to top things off.  A borosilicate glass pod pops out to say helo from a beautifully enameled crown calyx.The purple daggers sneak out for a peek when the pod's sides are closed. 

Feels good and is fun to play with!

name: Crown, Heart and Scallop Pendant
description:
This component heavy pendant celebrates all things regal, honorable and tasty! Featuring some brass stampings along with some PMC3 and CopperClay additions.

I love how this piece moves and opens and reveals surprises along the way! 

Soldered jump rings hold crowns together, scallops to crowns and hearts and pods together.

From top jump ring to bottom of scallop is 2 1/4" long x  1 1/4" width on the crown!

name: PMC3 Pendant,
description:
This 1 1/4" diameter pendant features some cold grown beautiful patina on the silver and a gorgeous fire patina on the brass backing, highlighted by a smattering of balled up fine silver that moves slightly.

This creation offers up a void that you might want to fill with something meaningful, or leave 'as is' to enjoy the color and smoothness.

name: PMC Lotus Pendant
description:
This two part pendant features a PMC3 Sakura motif with holes and moving parts~The 'seeds' are all balled up fine silver. The two parts come together to describe a space that something could be added to for additional meaning, i.e. a resin addition?

It is beautiful as is with a cold grown patina on the fine silver top, the bottom is a dapped brass disc that has been fire patinaed, the finish will continue to change and mellow over time but neither of the metals tarnish like sterling or copper will.

This measures  1 1/4" diameter.

A soldered sterling jump ring holds these pieces together.

name: Vintage Disc Necklace
description: This fabulous piece features vintage vinyl discs that move and change position to keep the piece kinetic as well as a big holed borosilicate bead that moves. The poppy pod has been electroformed and enameled~ All of this  comes together as a distinctive piece, with playful parts...and it will fit anyone!

name: Fire Pod
description: This 1 1/2" pod has a soldered silver jump ring to attach this 'void' to a chain, ribbon or neck wire. The void offers up an opportunity for you and I to collaborate, what would you like to see inside? There are also 2 holes on the bottom of the pod that you can hang a finial of individual interest from~ How will you add to it?

name: Vintage Glass Cabochons~ In Blue and Amber
description:
These 25mmx13mm transparent  and ribbed glass cabochons offer a clear, clean and elegant shape.

 The glass is fully transparent offering up the possibility of altering color through layering an interesting piece of fabric underneath... or something reflective? I can never resist that.

Limited supply.

name: Large Pressed Carnelian Cabochons~ Vintage Japanese
description: These great cabs measure 25mmx18mm and have a deeply pressed floral design. The colors are a mixed carnelian with a hint of milky,swirly white.

name: Milky Glass Square Cabochon~Vintage~ Japanese
description:
These 16mm square milky glass cabs are the epitome of 'cool' color. They look like the freshness of cucumbers and watermelon. 

They are an embossed loosely interpreted floral design, each one different from the next.

name: Wavy Glass Cabochon~ Vintage: 2 types, Irridized or Plain
description:
These elegant cabs measure 30mmx17mm, a touch more elegant in proportion than most ovals.

 I love these either way, with or without Irridizing, one feels dressier to me than the other. I have more of the irridized ones, limited in number at any rate.

name: Smoky Grey Diamond Cabochon~ Vintage
description:
This lovely foil backed cabochon measures 12x18mm. The foil lets some light be reflected off of the high crystaline like surface. 

These are not pristine, there are scratches on the foil but it doesn't affect the top side.

name: Glowing Red Siren Cabochons~ VIntage
description:
These vintage mirrorbacked 20mm cabochons are beautiful. They are in excellent shape and the color is divine.

Bead embroiderers, need a little 'light' in your piece?

name: Yellow Glass Eyes~ 2 Sizes
description:
These glass eyes are a great color and design element when taken out of context, the concentric circles offer an exciting addition to your bead embroidery.

The large ones measure 30mm, the smaller 20mm.

name: Vintage Icy Blue Cabochon~Vintage Glass~ West German
description:
These 18 mm glass cabochons are beautiful. 

They are not pristine, the mirrored backing has scratches on it but I find it doesn't hamper or interrupt the color on the viewing side. These are highly textured and are an exceptionally beautiful color, whether it be the ice blue light one or the richer sometimes irridized darker blue, you choose.

They are priced per unit, but I will price them at 6 for $10 if you are interested in a grouping of them.

name: Bronze Slide Necklace~ 3 slides
description:
This is what I am apt to wear on a daily basis. I love that it goes with any thing, can be dressy or casual and fits anyone.

I have created the neck ring long to double around the neck, offering the slides to be assembled in an order and rhythm to please by the unexpected option of stringing onto one or both cables.

The slides are made from Bronze Clay and offer a warm color to contrast with the steel and sterling cable.

The neck cable measures 30" with an added hand made sterling friction clasp.

name: Fine Silver Slide Neckpiece
description:
This is what I am apt to wear on a daily basis. I love that it goes with any thing, can be dressy or casual and fits anyone.

I have created the neck ring long to double around the neck, offering the slides to be assembled in an order and rhythm to please by the unexpected option of stringing onto one or both cables.

The slides are made from Fine Silver and offer a warm color to contrast with the steel and sterling cable.

The neck cable measures 30" with an added hand made sterling friction clasp.

name: Bronze Slide Neckpiece 2
description:
This is what I am apt to wear on a daily basis. I love that it goes with any thing, can be dressy or casual and fits anyone.

I have created the neck ring long to double around the neck, offering the slides to be assembled in an order and rhythm to please by the unexpected option of stringing onto one or both cables.

The slides are made from Bronze Clay and offer a warm color to contrast with the steel and sterling cable.

The neck cable measures 30" with an added hand made sterling friction clasp.

name: Bronze Slides
description:
These Bronze slides offer a simple way to showcase an individual focal bead with the added option of using some or all of the columns that keep the slides separate as anchors for embellishment.

They measure 1/1/2" diameter for the large one; 1 1/4 diameter for the medium; and  3/4" diameter for the small one.  They are 1/4" deep.

Shown are both sides of slides.

name: Hand Felted Embellished Brooch
description:
This lovely brooch made from hand felted wool has been embellished with glass Magatamas, new and vintage sequins and size 11 and 14 seed beads, all sewn onto the felted surface. The vinyl leaves add dimension and sparkle.

It measures 3" long by 1" wide and offers a tie tac finding which is also sewn into the brooch.

name: Twisted Steel Bracelets
description:
The twisted steel bracelets are made by me using heat and twisting. They are topped with Borosilicate pod beads made here in my Orange, MA studio, also by my hand.

I love to wear these, they make a nice sound, especially when 2 are worn together.

They are made using a standard size length of steel and then bent around a bracelet mandrel. They can be adjusted but theyare not meant to be bent and rebent, the metal becomes brittle. When you have found the ideal fit please leave it there. It wants to slide over the hand.

They each have a unique twist pattern.

name: Twisted Brass Bangles
description:
These twisted brass bangles are twisted while heating the metal, the Borosilicate glass beads are made separately and affixed to the ends creating visual interest and sparkle.

They are all made the same length and bent around a bracelet mandrel. This can be adjusted but not meant to be adjusted every time. When you find a size that works for your wrist please leave it there, the metal will become brittle with repeated adjustments.

They measure approximately. 3" in diameter. I like to wear 2 together for sound and interaction!

options.name: pod end with red accent (the brassiest color in metal)

name: Viking Knit Brass Neckpiece
description:
This viking knit neckpiece is fortified with a memory steel inside the knit to keep it round. I have embellished it with a beautiful hand carved vegetable ivory bead and a hand felted end topped with an iridescent Magatama, a spiky rubber bead and a pumice bead all offering an interesting textural juxtaposition, what I love to do!

It measures 26" long and can be relatively loosely draped around your neck.

name: Ivory and Shell Bracelet
description:
This special piece includes a variety of materials including ivory, shell, vintage lucite, peyote stitched wooden bead, vintage sequins and Japanese Magatamas.

I love the way that it looks and feels. It will fit any size wrist!

name: Shell Neckpiece
description:
This 22" neckpiece is a real statement. It drapes around your neck without any clasp/closure and stays where you put it. A variety of materials come together to offer a collage of materials, a peyote stitched beaded bead coupled with hand dyed vintage lucite, pumice beads toped off with Magatama and dagger beads.

I have included a piece on a neck that operates similarly. This one features Black vinyl coupled with enameled and electroformed seed pods. Not for sale.

name: Vintage Vinyl Disc Bracelet
description:
This looks and feels like old paper, though much more durable.

Depending on the light source the discs pick up light and create an interesting shadow between each disc. A peyote stitch covers the triangular focal bead on the end with the red, Black and berry end. The other end features a flocks velveteen larger bead and a berry made of multiple small black glass daggers. This will fit any size wrist, measures 2" in diameter.

name: Vintage Brass Mesh Bracelet
description:
These blanks can be used as is or embellished in any number of ways. I have tied a length of elk skin into the channel and then tied into it with a series of hand made bronze pieces. You can sew into the mesh or string anything into the channel and close with a crimp bead!

The sky is the limit.

I have found these to fit a majority of wrists, excepting the very largest and smallest of wrists. There is a small amont of give to the mesh which makes them very comfortable.

They measure 2 7/8" diameter in the round but can be made oval and measure 3 1/8"which enable a larger group to fit them over your hand.

name: Samples
description: These are not for sale. They are ideas for things that you might do with the following stampings. You will see that they come up with a $150 price tag, this is because the software would not let me show you them without a price tag, sorry for any confusion.

name: Serrated flower bead cap
description: This 3/4" floral bead cap is a perfect size to sit atop any number of beads.

name: Winged Leaf
description:
This component is available in a left and right option. I like these as earrings, they take color beautifully and come alive with their deep embossing.

Again, two together joined with a jump ring create a component with volume, what will you put inside?

They measure 1 1/2"x 3/4"

name: Floral Termination
description:
I like to use these in pairs to create volume at the bottom of things, earrings, pendants, brooches. I have successfully enameled these, differing the color inside and out for a surprising spot of color when they move about.  A  jump ring holding the two sides together will let you  string something else onto the jump ring that might nestle inside the two halves.

They measure 3/4"x3/4"

name: Long Foldover Finial or termination ending
description:
This long and lean foldover finial is extremely detailed, when you add pigment the details become clearer.

I like to use these at the end of an earring or the dangles off of a locket.
an easy way to add visual interest to the bottom of things.

name: Skull and Crossbones
description:
These well rendered stampings create yet another void...what would you put in yours? By putting 2 together the void presents an opportunity to find some meaningful trinket to attach inside and either show off or keep secret!

2 sizes:
Small 3/4"x3/4"
Large 2"x2"

name: Roses, 2 sizes
description:
These 3 dimensional roses can be manipulated to fit over a variety of shapes and sizes. I personally love the ribbed surface and the way that it takes pigment. Try some alcohol inks, paint on, wipe off. The details become so much more apparent and rich.

They are available in 2 sizes.
Small measures 7/8"x3/4"
large measures  1"x 1"

name: Egyptian Floral Brass pieces
description:
These components take color in the most lovely way. What you see here is the result of putting a small pile of these in a 400 degree oven and keeping an eye on them until I like the results.

This will alter all brass pieces, the longer you heat them the darker they will get.

These go together to create a little compartment with just the addition of a jump ring to hold two together.

They measure 1" long.

Nail polish will add some color, if you wipe it while polish is still wet the pigment stays in the low spots and you are able to bring the high spots back to metal for contrast, lovely.

name: Vintage Brass Fluted Bead Caps
description:
These vintage pieces are a wonderful addition to your assemblages, steam punk, anyone?

They measure 7/8" in diameter and can be made more domed with the use of a dapping block.

Warmly patinaed with age.

name: Vintage Brass Bead Caps~ 4 sizes/styles
description:
These vintage bead caps offer a fringe benefit when strung up, they offer space where the stem of the cap rises up to give space and rhythm. Three of them strung together make a nice earring.

Many strung together?  I love the opportunity to terminate the end with a nice 5-10 millimeter bead to sit in the cone of these pieces. They can bridge the gap between organic, natural design and the mechanical integration of ideas.

Sizes:
Large; 1/2" tall x 3/8" across.
Small 3/8" tall x 1/4" across.
Serrated Cap 1/2" x 3/8" across
Floral Cap 1/2" x 1/4"

name: Perforated Leaves
description:
I started to embellish this component to use as earrings and thought that I would share a possible use for these left and right sided leaves.

They measure 1 1/4' long x 3/4' wide.

They look great as earrings as they frame the face ,turning into your jaw.

name: Simple Scallop, large and small
description:
This large scallop is great in its simplicity. It can be a somewhat 'silent partner' in the construction of an assemblage, with a nice long void to fill. 

The smaller shell is diminutive in scale, I like to put two together and use it as the termination at the end of a design.

Large measures 2" in length x 1 1/4" at the broadest part.
Small measures 3/8"x 3/8"

*Please note, there are no holes. It is easy to drill, as long as you use a set to give your drill bit a place to grab.

name: Geranium Leaves ~ 2 sizes
description:
These powerfully textured brass leaves offer the best in 3D. They are heavily embossed so they take pigment well and offer a nest for added components.

The small leaf measures 1" x 1", the large one 2" x 2".

name: Ruffled Scarflette~Pattern by Karen Flowers
description: This 3 page PDF file will show you everything you need to know in order to knit this lovely 'scarflette' out of 1 skein of yarn! Karen uses simple directions and you'll see three different versions of this.

name: Borosilicate Beads of Nature
description: This book shows my beads, the process and development of color and form as well as pictures of some finished work and documented stages of production. Let me know if you want an autographed copy!

name: Cool Colored Fleece~6 Pack
description: Here you have an ounce of six different colored balls of wool fleece, great for felting, both wet and needle felting.Colors may vary, always cooool, tho’.

name: Hot Colored Fleece~6 Pack
description: This hot colored collection of wool fleece (1 ounce of each color) is great for both wet and dry (needle) felting. Flowers anyone? colors may vary, always hot, hot, hot!

name: Detailed Diminutive Flower Sequins~ two colors
description:
These are another layering addition, they measure 5 mm. across but can be layered over a round sequin with the same measurement as the delicacy lets you see to the layer below.

Approximately 80 pcs. per package.

name: Gold Tri Lobe Sequins
description: These tri lobe sequins are a great shape to embellish with. The lighter gold color are made from vinyl, the darker bronze color are metal. Approximately 50 sequins per package.

name: Blue Fluted Sequins
description: These cool sequins are a rendition of some vintage sequins that I once had, the good news is that these are more permanent! Those other ones were made of gelatin and they disappeared when I got them wet! Approximately 50 sequins. 7mm. I also have them in 10 mm.

name: Rose Fluted Sequins
description: These are the best! This rosy coloration enhances pretty much any other color it is up against. Great to use en mass. Approximately 50 sequins. 7mm.

name: 5 New Leaf Sequins, colors are great!
description:
These transparent leaves have an AB finish which adds a nice dimension, sort of like insect wings. The last picture is an opaque burgundy, looks great with many colors! 

There are approximately 30 sequins per package and they measure 15mmx8mm.

name: Green Leaf Sequins
description: These great sequins show green from one angle, orange from another direction. They are fabulous for applique, they add another dimension to your work! Approximately 30 pieces. 15mm.x8mm.

name: Top Drilled Pendants, several color options!
description: These vintage lucite drop beads are a great ending to a lariat as featured in Octobers' Beadwork magazine. The light plays through them in a lovely way! The top drill can easily accommodate a number of findings with the addition of a drop of epoxy. They measure 25mmx10mm at the broadest part of the bulb.

name: Vintage Shells
description: These vintage 1 1/2" long cinnabar colored lucite shells are great. I've used them as earrings alone and as necklaces in conjunction with other ingredients, they don't need much to make a statement.

name: Flat Discs
description: These cool, steel, flat discs add a new dimension to any assemblage. I like to dome them with a dapping block and use them as bead caps. 22mm.

name: Wooden Brush/Pendant
description: These brushes make the best pendants! They are old, no paint on the name that is stamped on them. 1 1/2' diameter.

name: Borosilicate Flower Beads (5)
description: These irresistable two-toned color beads are a great addition to any necklace, earrings or bracelet. They range from a lovely orangey-red through purple. This is for a bundle of 5 beads.

name: A Brass Acorn
description:
This wonderful brass acorn measures 3/4"x1", with a depth of 1/3".
The void created when two are held together with a jumpring gives you a great void to fill with treasure, maybe some resin added to.......?, the finial added to anything.

name: A Brass Acorn Top and/or bottom
description:
This heavily textured bead cap offers a wonderful option of adding color which brings out the texture that is embossed on the surface, I have used nail polish here and wiped away the high spots before it dried.

This cap fits many beads at 10 mm across. Also listed, a vintage acorn shape that fits exactly inside!

name: Calyx type or Thistle bead cap
description:
These lovely and detailed brass bead caps measures 5/8" long x 1/2" wide.

They can be pushed in or pulled out to accommodate a number of bead sizes and look terrific when color is added to enhance the stamped detail.

I also have the 'calyx' in a smaller version, it measures 1/2" long.

name: Three Brass Bead Caps~
description:
All three of these caps are great, it just depends whether you want a 'straight' one, a 'flip' or a 'pageboy'!

They are all heavily embossed with a leaf veining pattern and measure 5/8" tall x 1/2" wide.

name: A Floral Rose Bead Cap
description:
This linearly embossed cap is adjustable to fit a variety of bead sizes and shapes. As it comes it measures 5/8" x 5/8" at its widest point.

Wonderful with pigment added as there is a highly defined texture on the surface

name: A Three Tiered flower
description:
This multi tiered bad 'cap' is much like the top of a pineapple. Full of texture and energy. You could set a bead or something small into the innermost layer and then set the petals down as prongs!

It measures 7/8" wide x 3/8" high.

name: A Three Leaved Layer
description:
This lovely Brass leaf layer is embossed with a repouse type stamping, the detail is great for painting and shaping. I use this frequently in the layering of my ornaments/pendants.

It measures 1 3/8" across.

name: Two  Different Petaled Floral Layers
description:
All of these shapes can be layered and altered, either with pigments or dapping or pliers.

These two petal type layers each have an embossed surface, just right for picking up detail when colored.

The more rounded shape measures 1 1/8" across.

The pointier, squared off end shape measures  1" across.

name: 3 Different Leaf Layers
description:
These three leaf like layers add a nice dimension to a stacking effect. They each have different characters and patterns, being grouped together due to the five leaves.

The 2 larger ones measure 1 1/2 in  diameter.

The more delicate one that looks like a palm is 1 1/4" in diameter.

name: 2 Great Layers for Pendants/Ornaments
description:
One of these layers is brass, the other copper, both are great for texture and surface pattern.

They measure 1 1/4 in diameter.

They both respond well to dapping and coloring.

options.name: Brass Flower (smaller version of Copper Vintage piece

name: 8 Lobed Smooth Layers
description:
These are easily bent to create a bead cap of sorts, either side up!

The gray ones are steel, the copper, a vintage style with a veneer of copper.

They each measure  1 1/4" in diameter.

name: A Tulip Bead Cap
description:
This is another one of the adjustable bead caps. There is a lovely and realistic texture to the surface of this tulip and it opens up!

It is made of brass and measures 7/8" x 1/2".

name: A Large Vintage Copper Floral Layer
description: This piece measures 2" in diameter and makes a great bottom layer for a large pendant/ brooch.

name: 4 - way leaves, 2 sizes
description:
This delicate and realistically veined leaf is a nice layer....to add variety to the mostly round components. I also have it in a larger version.

The small version measures 1 1/4" across.
large, 2 1/2" x 2"

name: Urchin Top- 2 sizes
description:
This highly textured top calls for a patina or paint and then steel wool off the high spots to reveal the metal. I love to dome it with a daping block and use it in my stacks of flowers and leaves!

The small one measures 3/4" across.
The large one measures 15/16th of an inch across.

name: A Large Vintage Brass Link
description:
If you like fire, take a torch to this and watch the colors grow! I like to use these as links and fuse fine silver links to hold it all together. 7 is a good number for a necklace.


They measure 1 3/4" x 1 1/4".

name: A sweet and petit layer!
description:
I love this piece for its natural color as well as its delicacy. When put on top of a series of other colored metals, this looks great. The current stock is made from brass, consequently it is yellow in color.

Small but mighty.

It measures 3/4" in diameter.

name: A Foldover Finial
description:
This small but elegant finial leaf comes about by folding over the piece. It looks great with color added.

Open, it measures 1 1/4", folded over it is 5/8".

name: A Highly Textured Layer~Brass
description:
This is a great layer that works well with dapping and coloring. It has a rich linear texture.

It measures 1 1/4" across.

name: Scalloped concave pieces~Great locket material
description:
I have 4 sizes of this shape, I love it. It is a great finial to hang off of something larger if you use the small one, the medium is nice just alone, and the large one? It is great to paint and fill with surprises! I like to have a locket within a locket within a locket!


 The x small one measures 1/2" x 5/8" in length, small 1 1/4",  medium 2", large 3".

name: Pine Cone Finial/Charm
description:
These  purely decorative pinecones are the greatest, they are sealed closed, not a locket type but are a wonderful addition to the bottom of anything. I have included an image of one of the pinecones that I added pigment to in order to show you the embossed texture.

They measure 5/8" high x 3/8" wide.

name: Bees ~ 4 sizes
description:
These great bees  offer such a great opportunity for play, They can be colored, two put together and then filled with ?, you decide.

The baby Bee measures 3/4" x3/4" at his wing span.
Medium Bee 1 1/2" x 1 3/4".
Large Bee 2 1/4" x 2 1/2"

name: Scarab~ 3 sizes
description:
Color them, add a jump ring and fill with a surprise!

small 1 1/4"x 3/4"
medium 1 3/4" x 1 1/8".
large 2" x 1 1/4"

name: Flying Insects- 4 sizes
description:
This incredible flying insect offers an interior for collaging, imbedding or suspending.

I've shown some color on the outside, done with nail polish.
 I offer 4 sizes, ranging from 1/2"  to 2" long and the wingspan measuring  2 1/2" across.

Once again, I love to use this as a locket/void where I can put things in the interior with resin or epoxy pieces or cold connect or solder. These brass pieces withstand a tremendous amount of abuse....if you don't like how it is turning out just use steel wool and bring it back to a brass surface and start again.

name: Small Brass Hearts
description: These diminutive hearts measure 1/2" high x 3/8" wide. They are not drilled but can easily be, I like to connect 2 together with a jump ring and fill the void.
